str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of presbuteros; the order of elders, i.e., Israelite Sanhedrin or Christian 'presbytery'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Damascus. Of Hebrew origin; Damascus, a city of Syria.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To travel, journey, go, die.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To punish, avenge myself on. From a comparative of time and ouros; properly, to protect one's honor, i.e. To avenge.
